value.title: Google Is Using AI to Cut Down on False Info in 'Featured Snippets' Results
value.excerpt: AI models are also helping Google understand when featured snippets are not useful, particularly in cases that have no real answer.

value.title: Stratum AI Revolutionizes Miners’ Deep Learning Of What’s Below Ground
value.excerpt: Mining operators need more accurate estimations of where target minerals are located beneath the ground so they can drill and extract once instead of multiple times. Stratum AI provides a deep learning algorithm to better model the exact location of where wanted minerals are located underground.

value.title: Artificial intelligence improves outcomes of cognitive behavioral therapy in chronic pain: JAMA
value.excerpt: USA: Use of artificial intelligence for adjusting treatment in cognitive behavioral therapy intervention for chronic pain (AI-CBT-CP) can achieve noninferior and possibly better outcomes relative to standard cognitive behavioral therapy while increasing access and reducing therapist costs,

value.title: The power of now: How AI is propelling customer experience transformation
value.excerpt: Conversational AI is becoming the key to positive customer experiences, automated self-service and real-time agent support.

value.title: Xiaomi CEO says it has 140 vehicles across China testing autonomous driving
value.excerpt: Xiaomi Corp is currently running tests on 140 vehicles across China for autonomous driving, CEO Lei Jun said on Thursday.

value.title: Implementing AI? You'd Better Think About Security First
value.excerpt: While AI has been a game-changer for solving complex business problems, there is a security risk landscape associated with it. Let's explore three areas.

value.title: Aramco’s Prosperity7 powers AI drug firm Insilico’s $95M round
value.excerpt: Hong Kong-based drug discovery and development company Insilico has secured fresh capital at a time that its CEO described as a “biotech winter.” The firm has raised $35 million on the heels of its last tranche in June,

value.title: A beginner’s guide to the AI apocalypse: The democratization of ‘expertise’
value.excerpt: They say "garbage in, garbage out," but what happens when our data's the garbage and big tech starts feeding it back to us in a nice wrapper?

value.title: Realising scientists are the real superheroes
value.excerpt: Meet Edgar Duéñez-Guzmán, a research engineer on our Multi-Agent Research team who’s drawing on knowledge of game theory, computer science, and social evolution to get AI agents working better together.

value.title: Meta's New AI-Powered Chatbot Isn't 'Crazy' About Facebook
value.excerpt: Sitting in front of a computer screen, I'm typing messages to a new chatbot created by Facebook parent company Meta. We talk about pizza, politics and even social media. "What do you think about Facebook?

value.title: Amazon's Alexa scientists demonstrate bigger AI isn't always better
value.excerpt: Despite deep learning's obsession with big models and generalist approaches, Amazon shows top results can be had with economical and somewhat focused, if not specialized, models.

value.title: Use computer vision to measure agriculture yield with Amazon Rekognition Custom Labels
value.excerpt: In the agriculture sector, the problem of identifying and counting the amount of fruit on trees plays an important role in crop estimation. The concept of renting and leasing a tree is becoming popular, where a tree owner leases the tree every year before the harvest based on the estimated fruit yeild.

value.title: 10 top artificial intelligence (AI) solutions in 2022
value.excerpt: As AI-powered technologies continue to advance and more organizations adopt them, IT leaders must be sure to ask themselves how the solutions they choose fit into their goals as a business.

value.title: The Importance of International Norms in Artificial Intelligence Ethics
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence has arrived as a multi-purpose tool. The United States and its allies need to do more to establish norms and ensure AI is used in a way that does not harm human rights.

value.title: Amazon SageMaker Automatic Model Tuning now supports SageMaker Training Instance Fallbacks
value.excerpt: Today Amazon SageMaker announced the support of SageMaker training instance fallbacks for Amazon SageMaker Automatic Model Tuning (AMT) that allow users to specify alternative compute resource configurations. SageMaker automatic model tuning finds the best version of a model by running many training

value.title: Tesla self-driving smear campaign releases ‘test’ that fails to realize FSD never engaged
value.excerpt: A Tesla Full Self-Driving smear campaign started by a California billionaire running for Senate has a new attack ad based on a FSD Beta “test,” where they failed to realize they never engaged FSD Beta during the test.

value.title: How artificial intelligence can make our food safer
value.excerpt: Food recalls could be a thing of the past if artificial intelligence (AI) is utilized in food production, according to a recent study from UBC and the University of Guelph.

value.title: Machine Learning At The Forefront Of Telemental Health
value.excerpt: Michael Stefferson received his PhD in Physics from the University of Colorado before deciding to make the jump into machine learning (ML). Here's why he did, and why AI can transform the future of telemental health.

value.title: AI takes the 'real' you into the metaverse
value.excerpt: Posted . 08/10 A London-based startup wants to help you step into the metaverse with your 'real' face instead of the cartoo

value.title: AI and computer vision powers growing shop-and-go platform
value.excerpt: AiFi, which is powered only by cameras and computer vision, announced today that it now boasts a total of 80 checkout-free stores worldwide.

value.title: Getting Deeper With Advanced Analytics: Become A More Data-Driven Company With The Help Of AI
value.excerpt: Whether you are a manager or executive, the following primer will help you use AI analytics beyond streamlining operational processes and improving products and services—to make far better business decisions.

value.title: China creates its most powerful GPU Biren BR1100, reducing its dependency on NVIDIA's AI GPUs
value.excerpt: The Biren BR1100 is based on a 7nm process, houses 77 billion transistors, and is reportedly faster than NVIDIA's Ampere in AI power.

value.title: The Morning After: Kim Kardashian is the face of Beats’ skin-colored earbuds
value.excerpt: President Biden signs CHIPS Act to boost semiconductor production, Kim Kardashian is the face of Beat’s skin-colored earbuds, Ford will reopen F-150 Lightning orders this week at a much higher starting price.

value.title: Machine Learning Is Causing a ‘Reproducibility Crisis’ in Science
value.excerpt: AI hype has researchers in fields from medicine to political science rushing to use techniques that they don’t always understand—causing a wave of spurious results.

value.title: Machine learning is top skill in demand for data scientist jobs in India: Report
value.excerpt: Python remains the most used programming language across all sectors and MS Excel, Tableau and Power BI are the top three visualisation tools used by data science professionals, according to the repor
